item.title: ARC Raiders’ New Map Has Been Visited Over 25 Million Times
item.content:encoded:
Last week, Embark Studios released the North Line update for ARC Raiders, the electrifying new extraction shooter. This update introduced the Stella Montis map, an intense facility carved into a mountainside high above all the other maps.

Despite being a PvP haven and a massive threat that features the new deadly ARC enemy, the Shredder, Stella Montis has been visited ‘over 25 million’ times.

ARC Raiders Players Love Stella Montis

Stella Montis is a stark contrast to the other maps in ARC Raiders, simply because it’s all internal and highly scientific. It’s not representative of the ruined world that sits in the Rust Belt, reflected in the likes of Blue Gate and Buried City. Instead, Stella Montis is a harsh, industrial, clinical environment with tight corridors, multiple levels, and plenty of PvP opportunities.

In a recent graphic published by Embark Studios, it was revealed that the new map has been visited more than 25 million times. It’s a fan favorite where PvP is concerned, so that’s most likely what the majority of those visits were for. There are also some new quests on Stella Montis that need to be completed, as well as stacks of loot unique to that map.

Elsewhere in the numbers, we learned that a whopping 26,923 Matriarch enemies have been eliminated, and a whopping 2.2 million Raiders (including myself) have been knocked down by the Shredder, the newest minor ARC enemy.

It’s small but extremely mighty.

Additionally, 37,218 Raiders managed to down themselves with the Deadline, the new hyper-powerful mine added with the North Line update, and a further 117 downed themselves with… rocks.

That’s right – rocks. Embark has no idea how they did that either.

What’s your fondest moment from Stella Montis? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server how you’re enjoying the map.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news about Roblox’s new age estimation feature

item.title: Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimension Release Date Explained—Exact Release Date & Expected Start Times
item.content:encoded:
The journey in Pokémon Legends: Z-A is not yet over, with additional content coming in the Mega Dimension DLC, and we’ve got all the release date details you need.

The Mega Dimension DLC for Pokémon Legends: Z-A is bringing a bunch of returning Pokémon to the game, alongside a new story to uncover and new legends to hunt down, expanding on the hours of content the game already has to offer.

If you can’t wait for the release date of Pokémon Legends: Z-A’s Mega Dimension DLC and want to know what time it will be available, we have all the details.

The Mega Dimension DLC for Pokémon Legends: Z-A will be released on December 10, bringing a host of new content to the game.

The paid-for DLC, which was initially announced before the game’s launch, and the full release date were announced earlier this month alongside a new trailer.

In the Mega Dimension DLC, a new adventure across a weird zone known as Hyperspace Lumiose beckons, with new Mega Evolution Pokémon to discover, including two Mega Raichu forms, and battles against powerful Pokémon that exceed the level 100 cap for the first time in the franchise’s history.

The official start time for the Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimension DLC has not been announced. However, based on past DLCs on Nintendo Switch platforms, we’ve got a fairly solid estimate.

Unlike the main releases of Legends: Z-A, which had a staggered release globally, the Mega Dimension DLC will be released simultaneously worldwide, meaning you won’t be able to take advantage of a New Zealand or Australian Nintendo account to jump in early.

Based on previous DLC releases on Switch consoles, including Scarlet and Violet’s The Teal Mask and The Indigo Disk, we expect the Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimension DLC to be available from 8 PM PT on December 9.

These times are not confirmed, however, and we’ll update this article accordingly if Pokémon provides an official release time.

The table below shows the expected start time for the Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimension DLC in major time zones across the world.

Have you finished Pokémon Legends: Z-A and are now waiting for the Mega Dimension DLC? Let us know in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, check out the new variants revealed for Pikachu and Snorlax, and read how Pokémon Pokopia can be played on the original Nintendo Switch.

item.title: Steam’s Highest Peak Player Count Game Of 2025 Might Surprise You
item.content:encoded:
We can picture it now: You’ve come into this news story all guns blazing, thinking you’ve cracked it. Steam is one of the biggest and most consistent metrics for measuring player numbers, but the platform’s biggest peak game of 2025 shocked us a bit.

What another incredible year for gaming releases. Hades 2 proves once again that it’s the king (Queen, in this case) of roguelikes, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a game for the ages, and the list honestly goes on. But everyone is always amped up by a game’s first week of release and what its peak player count is—using it as a barometer for success.

Pretty much every major release of 2025 has happened now, and Steam’s highest-peak game might raise an eyebrow or two.

Monster Hunter Wilds Has The Highest Steam Peak Of Any New 2025 Game

Capcom takes the crown for a new game with the highest Steam peak in 2025! Monster Hunter Wilds continued its mainstream success spectacularly in 2025. The action game reached an all-time peak of 1,384,608, according to SteamDB.

To put this into context, this is the fifth-highest peak in Steam history!

Another incredible fact is that one of the games you’d think might have been the peak game barely managed half of Wilds’ total—Battlefield 6. The return of EA’s shooter has blown everyone away, and we’d argue it’s taken the crown as the shooter of 2025: We can hear angry ARC Raiders fans sharpening tools in the background.

Battlefield 6’s highest Steam peak is 747,440, and other big games in 2025 haven’t fared too badly either: Hollow Knight: Silksong hit 587,150, ARC Raiders stole 481,966 of you at once, and even indie hit Schedule 1 cooked up an impressive 459,075 players.

Nothing even got close to 1 million, but Monster Hunter Wilds shrugged off the challenge in style. It is also still 2025’s best-selling game, which probably helps.

What did you think the answer was going to be? Have any of these figures caught you off guard? Let us know what you think of this fact. Plus, head to the Insider Gaming Discord Server and tell us what you think will be the most played game of 2026.

You should also read about Fortnite Adding Playable Unity Games in 2026 and news of Hytale Early Access ‘Coming Soon.’

item.title: Ants Empire Codes (November 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Ants Empire monthly redeem codes for November 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Food, Starfruit, Gold Leaf, Sugar and much more.

Ants Empire is all about building the best colony and completing Queen Ant’s quests. You must purchase the best Eggs to deploy the finest Ants to farm Food, in-game currency. Food runs the gameplay as it is used for various purposes. The notable ones include upgrading your colony, purchasing Eggs, unlocking new areas of the map, and much more. The usual grinding route will not only drain countless hours but also slow down your overall progress. That’s when the active Roblox Ants Empire codes appear in the form of a useful crosscut. The active codes can be redeemed for Food, Starfruit, Gold Leaf, Leaf, and Sugar. This guide will help you finish all the Queen Ant’s quests and run the best ant colony on the server before you know it. 

Active Ants Empire codes

Inactive Ants Empire codes

  • BOOST

Steps to redeem Ants Empire codes

  1. Launch Ants Empire and spawn on the map. 
  2. Press the settings logo icon on the left side. 
  3. Enter any active code into the “Enter Code” text box. 
  4. Click the “>” button to activate the code. 

More about Ants Empire codes

Here are all the details about the free rewards obtained from the codes: 

  • Leaf – A succulent food you can feed to your ants giving +100 XP
  • Gold Leaf – A premium currency which can be used to purchase special items. 
  • Star Fruit – A magical fruit you can feed to your ants to transform it into a new ant. 
  • Sugar – A sweet treat you can feed to your ants giving +1250 XP

Free Food can be used to unlock new areas and purchase the following accessories and tools from the Shop area: 

  • Saw – 1000 Food – Tool 
  • Flower Pot – 1250 Food – Backpack 
  • Axe – 3000 Food – Tool 
  • Bucket – 3650 Food – Backpack 
  • Sword – 7500 Food – Tool 
  • Large Backpack – 8750 Food – Backpack 

Eggs are an important feature of the Ants Empire. Use Food to buy and hatch different types of Ants to increase your colony’s efficiency: 

  • Worker Egg – 100 Food
  • Army Egg – 500 Food
  • Stinger Egg – 5000 Food
  • Leaf Cutter Egg – 200000 Food
  • Bullet Egg – 250000 Food

Head to the Starfruit corner to purchase Starfruits using Food. Below are all materials information with the price list: 

  • x1 Starfruit – 10000 Food
  • x10 Starfruit – 1361000 Food
  • x100 Star Fruit – 143.62m Food
  • x1000 Star Fruit – 8.28b Food

FAQs on Ants Empire codes

What are the latest codes for Ants Empire?

There are no new codes as of now. All of the active codes have been working for quite a while now.

What codes offer free Starfruit in Ants Empire?

Codes like “BONUS” and “herefishyfish” can be activated for Starfruits. 

When will the active codes expire in Ants Empire?

There are no expiration dates for the active codes. They are speculated to expire at any moment.

item.title: Hytale Early Access ‘Coming Soon,’ And Shows Off 16 Minutes Of Minecraft-Like Gameplay
item.content:encoded:
Hytale was the once-canceled dream that is now fully back in development. A new, lengthy gameplay trailer has been released, not only showing more of the game, but also saying that early access is on the horizon.

Riot Games shut down Hypixel Studios in June 2025, effectively ceasing Hytale’s development. It was showing a lot of promise, but the game—based on the Minecraft multiplayer server Hypixel—suddenly went up in smoke. The dream was revived in November 2025, and to show that the game is back, a new gameplay trailer is out.

Hytale Is Back In Development With Early Access Promised

We reported that Hytale was back after being reacquired by Hypixel Studios—rebought by founder Simon “Hypixel” Collins-Laflamme. The new ‘Breaking the Curse’ gameplay trailer shows off 16 minutes of pixel-perfect gameplay.

It has sword and shield action, combat rolling, exploration, tree chopping, dark and spooky forests, and everything you’re likely looking for.

Check out the full 16 minutes of Hytale gameplay right here.

We checked the video’s description to look for any extra action or developments. Our pixelated jaws dropped when we read: “This is the original legacy engine from the 2018 trailer, running on a four-year-old build as we push Hytale forward again. There’s a long road ahead, but early access is coming soon.“

It’s vague, which is understandable considering how fast this is all happening, but it offers assurances that Hytale is moving in the right direction.

Founder Simon also added this to the Hytale gameplay video:

“I promised players videos, screenshots and blog posts. One day after the acquisition, I’m keeping that promise. Now that you’ve seen the first gameplay footage in a long time, I’m heading back to work on the early access launch. The team will share more clips and screenshots as we go. It mattered to me to release raw footage today so we break the curse once and for all.”

Are you glad to see Hytale back? Could it offer significant competition to the unstoppable juggernaut that is Minecraft? Share your thoughts on Hytale and the genre in general via the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Check out Among Us’ Collaboration Announced With Stardew Valley and Battlefield 6 Going Free to Play From November 25 for One Week for more news.

item.title: Fortnite is Giving Out Free 80k XP For Two Days Only
item.content:encoded:
If you’re yet to complete The Simpsons Battle Pass in Fortnite this season, Epic Games has a treat for you as 80,000 worth of XP is available for free—but only for a limited time.

Fortnite is currently in the midst of The Simpsons mini-season, with Springfield taking over the Island, but the end is in sight with a huge end-of-chapter event poised to take place on November 29, opening the gate for the launch of Chapter 7.

Ahead of that huge event, Epic Games is seeking players to test the experience, and is offering a hefty 80,000 XP as an incentive.

Epic Games Dishing Out 80,000 Free XP

The Fortnite Status page on X (formerly Twitter) announced the incentive as part of a stress test for servers ahead of the end-of-chapter event, which is expected to attract thousands of players across the world.

Available on November 19th and 20th at 1:40 PM ET, the ‘Epic Event Test’ playlist will appear in Fortnite for players to join and help Epic Games “prepare for an awesome live event.”

Joining the event won’t provide spoilers for the live event, as it won’t actually be shown, and is instead to “help slam server configurations to make sure everything runs smoothly.”

The final major patch of The Simpsons mini-season, and the final patch before the end-of-chapter event, is taking place today, and it’s expected several spoilers will emerge as a result across social media—so keep away if you don’t want anything ruined.

Plenty has already emerged ahead of the launch of Chapter 7, which will reportedly include a revamp to the revive system, along with collaborations with the likes of Harry Potter and SpongeBob SquarePants.

What do you think we’ll see in the Fortnite End of Chapter Event? Let us know your predictions in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, find out how to activate Fortnite Crew with an Xbox Game Pass subscription, and check out how to hire characters in The Simpsons mini-season.

item.title: All Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Dark Ops Challenges, Listed
item.content:encoded:
Black Ops 7 has plenty to dig your teeth into, and long-term Call of Duty fans will know all about the Dark Ops challenges that lie ready to be completed across various game modes—and we’ve got the full list.

Dark Ops Challenges in Call of Duty titles award exclusive calling cards with mysterious objectives to complete that, unlike other challenges, do not show the necessary task to tick off.

We’re here to make your life a lot easier, however, as we’ve got the full list of Dark Ops Challenges across the Campaign, Multiplayer, and Zombies.

All Black Ops 7 Dark Ops Challenges

There are 22 Dark Ops challenges available in Black Ops 7 right now, with an additional two that were only available in the beta and are now unobtainable.

We’ve split all the challenges into their respective game modes below.

All Black Ops 7 Campaign Dark Ops Challenges

All Black Ops 7 Multiplayer Dark Ops Challenges

All Black Ops 7 Zombies Dark Ops Challenges

Have you completed any of these hidden challenges in Black Ops 7 yet? Let us know in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Black Ops 7, find out details of the upcoming Battle Pass, and learn how to Weapon Prestige in the game.
